model

Interface IPaintStrategy

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ADecoratorPaintStrategy, AnimatePaintStrategy, APaintStrategy, BallPaintStrategy, EllipsePaintStrategy, Fish1PaintStrategy, Fish2PaintStrategy, FixedColorDecoratorPaintStrategy, ImagePaintStrategy, MarioSonicPaintStrategy, MultiPaintStrategy, NiceFishPaintStrategy, PlanetPaintStrategy, RectanglePaintStrategy, ShapePaintStrategy, SquarePaintStrategy, SwimFishPaintStrategy, UprightImagePaintStrategy, UprightShapePaintStrategy

    public interface IPaintStrategy
    The top-level interface that fundamentally defines what a paint strategy can do. This is the view of the paint strategy from the perspective of the ball.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static IPaintStrategy NULL_OBJECT
      A no-op implementation of this interface.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void init(Ball host)
      Initialize the strategy and host ball.
      void paint(java.awt.Graphics g, Ball host)
      Paint the host onto the given Graphics context.

    • Field Detail

      • NULL_OBJECT

        static final IPaintStrategy NULL_OBJECT
        A no-op implementation of this interface.

    • Method Detail

      • paint

        void paint(java.awt.Graphics g,
           Ball host)
        Paint the host onto the given Graphics context. The exact nature of the manipulations required to get the ball's visual representation onto the screen is up to the implementing class and may or may not involve affine transforms.
        Parameters:
        g - a Graphics context that will be paint on
        host - a host Ball that the required information will be pulled from

      • init

        void init(Ball host)
        Initialize the strategy and host ball. This method must be run whenever the ball gets a new strategy, such as in a setPaintStrategy() method or even in the constructor of the ball. The safest way to do this is to have the constructor set the paint strategy field by calling the setPaintStrategy() method thus keeping the code to initialize the strategy only in a single location.
        Parameters:
        host - a host Ball that the required information will be pulled from
